summary: Olive E. Wagner was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from October 1977 to November 1978. Payroll and certification reports document her employment, position, and salary information during this period. While her specific role within the HSCA is not detailed, her consistent presence in these documents indicates sustained employment as a staff member.
significance: Medium. Olive E. Wagner's significance is moderate. She appears in multiple documents related to the HSCA, suggesting she was a staff member. While her exact role is unspecified, her consistent presence on payroll indicates a level of involvement in the committee's operations.
